intro: Sarcocephalus russeggeri, commonly known as the African wild coffee, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is adapted to dry conditions. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, though its botanical features are less well-documented compared to other species in its family.
